results.title: Killing Priscilla
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, A Great Scott, Jane Scott and Lizzy Gardiner
results.brief_description: Not so very long ago, Stephan Elliott wrote and directed a movie called ‘The Adventures of Priscilla Queen of the Desert’ - a low-budget film that proved to be a worldwide smash grossing over a hundred million dollars at the box office. Four years and one flop (‘Welcome to Woop Woop’) later, Elliott is making ‘Eye of the beholder’ a film with a twelve million dollar budget, and an impressive cast which includes Ewan McGregor, k.d. lang, Ashley Judd and Jason Priestley. The storyline promises action-adventure in nine American cities across four different seasons. The financing has been done outside the studio system - through a team of sales agents who want a profit - or else, adding undue pressure to the project. Enter Lizzy Gardiner. Academy Award-winning costume designer and friend of Elliott’s for more than twenty years. In addition to bringing her expertise as a costume designer, Gardina also brings a Sony 1000 DVC camera, and in a moment of insanity Elliott gives her permission to document the whole process. What transpires is a no-holds-barred account of the reality of commercial filmmaking in the late 1990s: a study in passion, power, madness and lies.

results.title: Killing of a Chinese bookie
results.brief_description: “The Killing of a Chinese Bookie” presents a portrait of a man who is so self-sufficient that he cannot become personally involved with anyone. Cosmo Vitelli, played by Ben Gazzara, is a nightclub owner who believes in conducting his personal and business affairs with plenty of flair and professionalism. When the mob threatens him he works desperately to save his face and the club.

results.title: Killing farm rats
results.brief_description: Portrays methods of killing rats on a large farm in Scotland. Chemical methods of control, such as gassing and pre-baiting are priveleged, but information on the long term deterence of rats is also provided.

results.title: Killers in Eden
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Granada International Productions, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and Klaus Toft
results.brief_description:
‘Killers in Eden’ is the story of perhaps the most extraordinary partnership ever forged between humans and wild animals. Locals in the Australian town of Eden claim that beginning in the mid-1800s an intimate and co-operative relationship developed between human whalers and killer whales.

The giant prey whales - minke whales, humpbacks, right whales, blue whales - were herded into Twofold Bay by the killer whales. This allowed the shore-based human whalers to close in for the kill. Working together in Eden, man and beast were able to do something neither could have managed on their own; killing the largest whales on earth. The two hunters then shared the spoils through an arrangement known as the ‘Law of the Tongue’.

Whale enthusiast Greg Mckee, who has researched this story for 15 years, joins forces with eminent zoologist Danielle Clode to investigate the intimate details of the relationship. Together, Greg and Danielle reveal not only the fascinating details of how the partnership began, but also why it tragically ended. A Co-production with Granada International.

results.title: Killer track
results.brief_description: Deals with long distance runner Tony Rafferty and his attempt to run the Birdsville Track from Maree to Birdsville. Endeavours to explain Rafferty’s motivation and shows the stress involved and levels of endurance required for such a run.

results.title: Killer on the move
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the danger of hydatid (sheep tapeworm) infestation, common in Tasmania. Discusses the problem, particularly as it affects children, and shows briefly surgical treatment for the removal of a hydatid cyst.

results.title: Killer at large
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Alistair Cooke and Frank Jacoby
results.brief_description: A genial and unsuspecting businessman brings smallpox from Asia to Europe and triggers an international manhunt in which the health authorities of many countries cooperate with the Epidemic Warning Service of the World Health Organisation.

results.title: Killer's kiss
results.creator_credit: Minotaur Productions, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Stanley Kubrick and Morris Bousel
results.brief_description: A struggling boxer recounts how his attraction to a young woman has drawn him into a world of shadows and omnipresent violence which threatens to overwhelm him. His life becomes imperiled when he protects a nightclub dancer from her gangster boss. Although filmed in New York locations, Kubrick’s independently financed second feature has the atmosphere of a waking nightmare rather than that of realistically based drama. Cast includes Frank Silvera, Jamie Smith, Irene Kane and Ruth Sobotka.

results.title: Kill the day
results.brief_description: An evocative study of a man just released from prison, Kill the Day is an evocative study of the “prison” formed by poverty and social deprivation. As in her other award winning shorts, Lynne Ramsey’s focus is not on the melodramatic but on the everyday poetics of working class Glaswegian life. By concentrating on the day to day activities of her main character, and by situating him in a realistically observed personal and social milieu, she shows herself to be not only influenced by filmmakers such as Mike Leigh and Robert Bresson, but as a uniquely inspired filmmaker in her own right.

results.title: Kill or be Killed
results.creator_credit: Kavalier, Ben Vlok and Ivan Hall
results.brief_description: Featuring top-notch karate action, this film about a kick-off competition between two opposing martial arts coaches offers all the fight scenes any lover of the genre could want. A martial arts champion (James Ryan) is lured to a desert fortress and what he thought would be an Olympic-style contest turns out to be a fight for survival against an army of martial arts gladiators.
